alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe; Halifax; Nash; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 11:17AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Warren, northeastern Nash, northern Edgecombe and Halifax Counties through 1215 PM EDT... At 1116 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southwest of Halifax, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Roanoke Rapids, Halifax, Scotland Neck, Littleton, Enfield, Weldon, Whitakers, Hobgood, Speed and Leggett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This thunderstorm is producing an excessive amount of deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter indoors and stay away from windows. If you cannot seek shelter indoors, an enclosed vehicle can provide safe shelter. Deadly lightning strikes can occur well ahead of an approaching storm, prior to the arrival of rain and wind.
